meanings.definition: A person who has or is thought to have superior tastes and interests in intellectual or cultural matters.
meanings.sent1: She is considered a highbrow in our group for her love of classic literature.
meanings.sent2: The highbrow at the art gallery could discuss paintings for hours.
meanings.sent3: The highbrow at the party only wanted to talk about philosophy, making everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: He was a highbrow among his friends, always delving into deep discussions about world politics.
meanings.sent5: The highbrow's book collection was so vast, it filled an entire room.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to or associated with intellectual or cultural interests or pursuits.
meanings.sent1: The museum hosted a highbrow event for art enthusiasts.
meanings.sent2: Her highbrow taste in music led her to appreciate classical compositions.
meanings.sent3: The highbrow book club met every week to discuss challenging novels.
meanings.sent4: The highbrow atmosphere of the opera house made her feel sophisticated.
meanings.sent5: His highbrow manners and refined speech impressed everyone at the dinner party.
